conclusion: Plan to describe the image and analyze the graph to determine when objects meet.
The image shows two velocity-time graphs for objects A and B with different starting velocities and linear acceleration.
Object A starts with a negative velocity and increases linearly to a positive velocity.
Object B starts with a positive velocity and increases linearly.
The question asks when the two objects meet, meaning their positions are equal.
Calculate the distance traveled by each object as a function of time to find when they meet.
Use the formula \( s = \int v \, dt \) for distance calculation.
For object A, express distance as the integral of its velocity function over time.
For object B, express distance as the integral of its velocity function over time.
Set the distances traveled by both objects equal: \( \int_{t_1}^{t_2} v_A \, dt = \int_{t_1}^{t_2} v_B \, dt \).
Solve for \( t \) when these integrals are equal, representing the meeting time.
Identify \( t \) from the graph where velocities match and distances are equal.
Object A meets object B at \( t = 3 \) based on the graph and calculations.
